refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: The GtkTreeViewColumn object is a visible column in a GtkTreeView widget.

refsect2.title: enum GtkTreeViewColumnSizing
refsect2.para: The sizing method the column uses to determine its width. Please note that GTK_TREE_VIEW_COLUMN_AUTOSIZE are inefficient for large views, and can make columns appear choppy.

listitem.simpara: Columns only get bigger in reaction to changes in the model
Columns resize to be the optimal size everytime the model changes.
Columns are a fixed numbers of pixels wide.

refsect2.title: GtkTreeCellDataFunc ()
refsect2.programlisting: void (*GtkTreeCellDataFunc) (GtkTreeViewColumn *tree_column, GtkCellRenderer *cell, GtkTreeModel *tree_model, GtkTreeIter *iter, gpointer data);
refsect2.para: A function to set the properties of a cell instead of just using the straight mapping between the cell and the model. This is useful for customizing the cell renderer. For example, a function might get an integer from the tree_model, and render it to the "text" attribute of "cell" by converting it to its written equivilent. This is set by calling gtk_tree_view_column_set_cell_data_func()

listitem.simpara: The GtkCellRenderer that is being rendered by tree_column
A GtkTreeIter of the current row rendered

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_view_column_new ()
refsect2.para: Creates a new GtkTreeViewColumn.

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_view_column_new_with_attributes ()
refsect2.para: Creates a new GtkTreeViewColumn with a number of default values. This is equivalent to calling gtk_tree_view_column_set_title(), gtk_tree_view_column_pack_start(), and gtk_tree_view_column_set_attributes() on the newly created GtkTreeViewColumn.

listitem.simpara: The title to set the header to.

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_view_column_pack_start ()
refsect2.para: Packs the cell into the beginning of the column. If expand is FALSE, then the cell is allocated no more space than it needs. Any unused space is divided evenly between cells for which expand is TRUE.

listitem.simpara: TRUE if cell is to be given extra space allocated to tree_column.

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_view_column_pack_end ()
refsect2.para: Adds the cell to end of the column. If expand is FALSE, then the cell is allocated no more space than it needs. Any unused space is divided evenly between cells for which expand is TRUE.

listitem.simpara: TRUE if cell is to be given extra space allocated to tree_column.

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_view_column_clear ()
refsect2.para: Unsets all the mappings on all renderers on the tree_column.

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_view_column_get_cell_renderers ()
refsect2.para: Returns a newly-allocated GList of all the cell renderers in the column, in no particular order. The list must be freed with g_list_free().

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_view_column_add_attribute ()
refsect2.programlisting: void gtk_tree_view_column_add_attribute (GtkTreeViewColumn *tree_column, GtkCellRenderer *cell_renderer, const gchar *attribute, gint column);
refsect2.para: Adds an attribute mapping to the list in tree_column. The column is the column of the model to get a value from, and the attribute is the parameter on cell_renderer to be set from the value. So for example if column 2 of the model contains strings, you could have the "text" attribute of a GtkCellRendererText get its values from column 2.

listitem.simpara: the GtkCellRenderer to set attributes on
The column position on the model to get the attribute from.

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_view_column_set_attributes ()
refsect2.para: Sets the attributes in the list as the attributes of tree_column. The attributes should be in attribute/column order, as in gtk_tree_view_column_add_attribute(). All existing attributes are removed, and replaced with the new attributes.

listitem.simpara: the GtkCellRenderer we're setting the attributes of

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_view_column_set_cell_data_func ()
refsect2.programlisting: void gtk_tree_view_column_set_cell_data_func (GtkTreeViewColumn *tree_column, GtkCellRenderer *cell_renderer, GtkTreeCellDataFunc func, gpointer func_data, GtkDestroyNotify destroy);
refsect2.para: Sets the GtkTreeViewColumnFunc to use for the column. This function is used instead of the standard attributes mapping for setting the column value, and should set the value of tree_column's cell renderer as appropriate. func may be NULL to remove an older one.

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_view_column_clear_attributes ()
refsect2.para: Clears all existing attributes previously set with gtk_tree_view_column_set_attributes().

listitem.simpara: a GtkCellRenderer to clear the attribute mapping on.

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_view_column_set_spacing ()
refsect2.para: Sets the spacing field of tree_column, which is the number of pixels to place between cell renderers packed into it.

listitem.simpara: distance between cell renderers in pixels.

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_view_column_get_spacing ()
refsect2.para: Returns the spacing of tree_column.

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_view_column_set_visible ()
refsect2.para: Sets the visibility of tree_column.

listitem.simpara: TRUE if the tree_column is visible.

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_view_column_get_visible ()
refsect2.para: Returns TRUE if tree_column is visible.

listitem.simpara: whether the column is visible or not. If it is visible, then the tree will show the column.

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_view_column_set_resizable ()
refsect2.para: If resizable is TRUE, then the user can explicitly resize the column by grabbing the outer edge of the column button. If resizable is TRUE and sizing mode of the column is GTK_TREE_VIEW_COLUMN_AUTOSIZE, then the sizing mode is changed to GTK_TREE_VIEW_COLUMN_GROW_ONLY.

listitem.simpara: TRUE, if the column can be resized

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_view_column_get_resizable ()
refsect2.para: Returns TRUE if the tree_column can be resized by the end user.

listitem.simpara: TRUE, if the tree_column can be resized.

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_view_column_set_sizing ()
refsect2.para: Sets the growth behavior of tree_column to type.

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_view_column_get_sizing ()
refsect2.para: Returns the current type of tree_column.

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_view_column_get_width ()
refsect2.para: Returns the current size of tree_column in pixels.

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_view_column_get_fixed_width ()
refsect2.para: Gets the fixed width of the column. This value is only meaning may not be the actual width of the column on the screen, just what is requested.

listitem.simpara: the fixed width of the column

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_view_column_set_fixed_width ()
refsect2.para: Sets the size of the column in pixels. This is meaningful only if the sizing type is GTK_TREE_VIEW_COLUMN_FIXED. The size of the column is clamped to the min/max width for the column. Please note that the min/max width of the column doesn't actually affect the "fixed_width" property of the widget, just the actual size when displayed.

listitem.simpara: The size to set tree_column to. Must be greater than 0.

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_view_column_set_min_width ()
refsect2.para: Sets the minimum width of the tree_column. If min_width is -1, then the minimum width is unset.

listitem.simpara: The minimum width of the column in pixels, or -1.

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_view_column_get_min_width ()
refsect2.para: Returns the minimum width in pixels of the tree_column, or -1 if no minimum width is set.

listitem.simpara: The minimum width of the tree_column.

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_view_column_set_max_width ()
refsect2.para: Sets the maximum width of the tree_column. If max_width is -1, then the maximum width is unset. Note, the column can actually be wider than max width if it's the last column in a view. In this case, the column expands to fill any extra space.

listitem.simpara: The maximum width of the column in pixels, or -1.

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_view_column_get_max_width ()
refsect2.para: Returns the maximum width in pixels of the tree_column, or -1 if no maximum width is set.

listitem.simpara: The maximum width of the tree_column.

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_view_column_clicked ()
refsect2.para: Emits the "clicked" signal on the column. This function will only work if tree_column is clickable.

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_view_column_set_title ()
refsect2.para: Sets the title of the tree_column. If a custom widget has been set, then this value is ignored.

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_view_column_get_title ()
refsect2.para: Returns the title of the widget.

listitem.simpara: the title of the column. This string should not be modified or freed.

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_view_column_set_expand ()
refsect2.para: Sets the column to take available extra space. This space is shared equally amongst all columns that have the expand set to TRUE. If no column has this option set, then the last column gets all extra space. By default, every column is created with this FALSE.
Since 2.4

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_view_column_get_expand ()
refsect2.para: Return TRUE if the column expands to take any available space.
Since 2.4

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_view_column_set_clickable ()
refsect2.para: Sets the header to be active if active is TRUE. When the header is active, then it can take keyboard focus, and can be clicked.

listitem.simpara: TRUE if the header is active.

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_view_column_get_clickable ()
refsect2.para: Returns TRUE if the user can click on the header for the column.

listitem.simpara: TRUE if user can click the column header.

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_view_column_set_widget ()
refsect2.para: Sets the widget in the header to be widget. If widget is NULL, then the header button is set with a GtkLabel set to the title of tree_column.

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_view_column_get_widget ()
refsect2.para: Returns the GtkWidget in the button on the column header. If a custom widget has not been set then NULL is returned.

listitem.simpara: The GtkWidget in the column header, or NULL

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_view_column_set_alignment ()
refsect2.para: Sets the alignment of the title or custom widget inside the column header. The alignment determines its location inside the button -- 0.0 for left, 0.5 for center, 1.0 for right.

listitem.simpara: The alignment, which is between [0.0 and 1.0] inclusive.

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_view_column_get_alignment ()
refsect2.para: Returns the current x alignment of tree_column. This value can range between 0.0 and 1.0.

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_view_column_set_reorderable ()
refsect2.para: If reorderable is TRUE, then the column can be reordered by the end user dragging the header.

listitem.simpara: TRUE, if the column can be reordered.

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_view_column_get_reorderable ()
refsect2.para: Returns TRUE if the tree_column can be reordered by the user.

listitem.simpara: TRUE if the tree_column can be reordered by the user.

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_view_column_set_sort_column_id ()
refsect2.para: Sets the logical sort_column_id that this column sorts on when this column is selected for sorting. Doing so makes the column header clickable.

listitem.simpara: The sort_column_id of the model to sort on.

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_view_column_get_sort_column_id ()
refsect2.para: Gets the logical sort_column_id that the model sorts on when this column is selected for sorting. See gtk_tree_view_column_set_sort_column_id().

listitem.simpara: the current sort_column_id for this column, or -1 if this column can't be used for sorting.

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_view_column_set_sort_indicator ()
refsect2.para: Call this function with a setting of TRUE to display an arrow in the header button indicating the column is sorted. Call gtk_tree_view_column_set_sort_order() to change the direction of the arrow.

listitem.simpara: TRUE to display an indicator that the column is sorted

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_view_column_get_sort_indicator ()
refsect2.para: Gets the value set by gtk_tree_view_column_set_sort_indicator().

listitem.simpara: whether the sort indicator arrow is displayed

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_view_column_set_sort_order ()
refsect2.para: Changes the appearance of the sort indicator.

This does not actually sort the model. Use gtk_tree_view_column_set_sort_column_id() if you want automatic sorting support. This function is primarily for custom sorting behavior, and should be used in conjunction with gtk_tree_sortable_set_sort_column() to do that. For custom models, the mechanism will vary.

The sort indicator changes direction to indicate normal sort or reverse sort. Note that you must have the sort indicator enabled to see anything when calling this function; see gtk_tree_view_column_set_sort_indicator().

listitem.simpara: sort order that the sort indicator should indicate

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_view_column_get_sort_order ()
refsect2.para: Gets the value set by gtk_tree_view_column_set_sort_order().

listitem.simpara: the sort order the sort indicator is indicating

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_view_column_cell_set_cell_data ()
refsect2.programlisting: void gtk_tree_view_column_cell_set_cell_data (GtkTreeViewColumn *tree_column, GtkTreeModel *tree_model, GtkTreeIter *iter, gboolean is_expander, gboolean is_expanded);
refsect2.para: Sets the cell renderer based on the tree_model and iter. That is, for every attribute mapping in tree_column, it will get a value from the set column on the iter, and use that value to set the attribute on the cell renderer. This is used primarily by the GtkTreeView.

listitem.simpara: The GtkTreeModel to to get the cell renderers attributes from.
The GtkTreeIter to to get the cell renderer's attributes from.
TRUE, if the row has children
TRUE, if the row has visible children

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_view_column_cell_get_size ()
refsect2.programlisting: void gtk_tree_view_column_cell_get_size (GtkTreeViewColumn *tree_column, GdkRectangle *cell_area, gint *x_offset, gint *y_offset, gint *width, gint *height);
refsect2.para: Obtains the width and height needed to render the column. This is used primarily by the GtkTreeView.

listitem.simpara: The area a cell in the column will be allocated, or NULL
location to return x offset of a cell relative to cell_area, or NULL
location to return y offset of a cell relative to cell_area, or NULL
location to return width needed to render a cell, or NULL
location to return height needed to render a cell, or NULL

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_view_column_cell_get_position ()
refsect2.para: Obtains the horizontal position and size of a cell in a column. If the cell is not found in the column, start_pos and width are not changed and FALSE is returned.

listitem.simpara: return location for the horizontal position of cell within tree_column, may be NULL
return location for the width of cell, may be NULL
TRUE if cell belongs to tree_column.

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_view_column_cell_is_visible ()
refsect2.para: Returns TRUE if any of the cells packed into the tree_column are visible. For this to be meaningful, you must first initialize the cells with gtk_tree_view_column_cell_set_cell_data()

listitem.simpara: TRUE, if any of the cells packed into the tree_column are currently visible

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_view_column_focus_cell ()
refsect2.para: Sets the current keyboard focus to be at cell, if the column contains 2 or more editable and activatable cells.
Since 2.2

listitem.para: X Alignment of the column header text or widget.
Whether the header can be clicked.
Column gets share of extra width allocated to the widget.
Current fixed width of the column.
Maximum allowed width of the column.
Minimum allowed width of the column.
Whether the column can be reordered around the headers.
Whether to show a sort indicator.
Sort direction the sort indicator should indicate.
Title to appear in column header.
Widget to put in column header button instead of column title.

listitem.simpara: the object which received the signal.
user data set when the signal handler was connected.
